## Interactive Plots using Plotly

We're going to use the rates of people who complete the College in US States from 1970 to 2017 in order to show the Plotly interactive plots

The data can be found in this URL: 
    https://data.ers.usda.gov/reports.aspx?ID=17829#Pa437f09210e34d798292928f388833c9_2_228iT2
 
 
```{r comment=FALSE, warning=FALSE,error=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)

college <- read.csv("CompletingCollegeUS.csv")

p <- ggplot(college) + aes(x=Year, y=Percent, color=Location) + geom_point() + ggtitle("College completion rates in US, 1970-2017")

ggplotly(p)
```
